intro: Stenandrium mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets and produces long, cylindrical fruits that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
